text:
On the other side of the door to Sonia’s room was an empty room. A sign was on the gate and a notice in the windows saying it was for rent. Sonia was used to the room being empty. But Mr. Svidrigaïlov was standing by the door, listening to what was happening. 

When Raskolnikov left, Svidrigaïlov paused for a moment, then quietly went to his own room next to the empty one. He brought a chair back to the door that led to Sonia’s room. He found the conversation interesting and wanted to listen comfortably without having to stand for a whole hour the next time.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Mr. Svidrigaïlov eavesdrops on Raskolnikov and Sonia's conversation, intrigued by their exchange.
